a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Production vs. consumption-based CO₂ emissions, United States
Annual consumption-based emissions are domestic emissions adjusted for trade. If a country imports goods the
CO₂ emissions needed to produce such goods are added to its domestic emissions; if it exports goods then this is
Note: This measures CO₂ emissions from fossil fuels and cement production only – land use change is not included.
